text: Bulbuls are a family of birds living in Africa, the Middle East and southern Asia. They are passerine songbirds. There are about 130 species in 24 genera. Many live in forests: the greenbuls, brownbuls, leafloves, or bristlebills. Most African species are found in rainforests whilst in Asia they live in more open areas. == Related pages == * Red-vented bulbul * Flame-throated bulbul * Red-whiskered bulbul Category:Passeri
title: Bulbul
